pull.title: Add IRC link to README.md
pull.body: I added IRC link README.md, now it is easier to enter the IRC.

events.body: Not sure if we should add a webchat link. It could lead to users joining the dev channel when the have end user problems...

Concept NACK

No webchat links please.

On one hand it is nice to make it easy to join the chat, on the other hand one of the reasons that we moved from `bitcoin-dev` to `bitcoin-core-dev` is that the former was getting too noisy. The new IRC channel is for development-related talk only, not for questions or support or ancillary discussion about bitcoin or bitcoin core. End-users should join `#bitcoin` not `#bitcoin-core-dev`.

So tend to agree with @jonasschnelli's sentiment.

events.message: Move Developer IRC link to CONTRIBUTING.md

events.body: With the move to CONTRIBUTORS I think it's okay.

Not sure about this change....
Moving the IRC channel away from the mailing list link and adding a webchat URL (IMO devs should not use webchats) looks after a step backward.
Meh, when it seems unlikely to get support, better leave it as is for now.
I think that moving link to #bitcoin-dev-core to CONTRIBUTING.md is good. Let's keep it (without webchat link).

So with the same reason we could move the mailing list to CONTRIBUTING.md?

Anyway, why is the `bitcoin-core-dev` mailing list mentioned nowhere?

How about moving it into a code block?
Developer IRC can be found on Freenode at `#bitcoin-core-dev`.
This is seemingly too controversial for such a simple change. Also seems that the OP deleted their account. Closing.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -37,7 +37,7 @@ The developer [mailing list](https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/mailman/listinfo/
 should be used to discuss complicated or controversial changes before working
 on a patch set.
 
-Developer IRC can be found on Freenode at #bitcoin-core-dev.
+Developer IRC can be found on Freenode at [#bitcoin-core-dev](https://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=#bitcoin-core-dev).
comments.body:
I am not convinced we should mention the dev chat in the readme...

We already link to CONTRIBUTING.md just three lines above. Do you mind to move the `Developer IRC can be found on Freenode at #bitcoin-core-dev.` to CONTRIBUTING.md ?

@@ -37,7 +37,7 @@ The developer [mailing list](https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/mailman/listinfo/
 should be used to discuss complicated or controversial changes before working
 on a patch set.
 
-Developer IRC can be found on Freenode at #bitcoin-core-dev.
+Developer IRC can be found on Freenode at [#bitcoin-core-dev](https://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=#bitcoin-core-dev).
